Articles.Content:
So, I had this mod in my old 0.90.0 gamedata folder, and I remember downloading it from [REDACTED], but the site no longer exists.

This mod was a Spy Camera science experiment and I used to mess with it back when I first found it - KSP version 0.22.

I do not remember who owned the mod, but please do update it for KSP 1.0.2.

Here is the link:

[SpyCamera](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/nc8of3vd9agy1c0/AACv-hVIAOsuDHDQGypQLSVya?dl=0)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-18T23:12:57Z" title="05/18/2015 11:12  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 18, 2015</time> by sumghai**
  
Removed reference to pirate mod website
Can you describe it? There are many good camera mods out there, but they each do different things.

> 
> Can you describe it? There are many good camera mods out there, but they each do different things.

Yes, he should really describe what it does since there is no link to it. Otherwise, how are we supposed to know what it does and if its worth it??

You might check out [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/46365-0-23-Hullcam-VDS-Added-new-cameras-by-Rubber-Ducky-Updated-30-Dec](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/46365-0-23-Hullcam-VDS-Added-new-cameras-by-Rubber-Ducky-Updated-30-Dec) , And didn't that mod just take a picture for Science points pretty sure VDS does all that ?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-18T18:38:42Z" title="05/18/2015 06:38  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 18, 2015</time> by Mecripp2**

@Chat, I will further explain this mod:

This mod adds in a spy camera and a return capsule - the camera can take "pictures" and only one of them can be stored in a return capsule/pod for return. The experiment is re-runnable up to 3 times before the film (for the pictures) is fully depleted. Then you can right-click on a capsule and store one film roll in the pod. You then jettison the pod (attached to some seperatrons) for recovery. The capsule can withstand a 150m/s impact (I am not sure about the heat resistance - may need to change).

You cannot transmit the film back, as it is film and must be recovered - like the Corona satellite missions. The pod is uncontrollable/uncommandable.

The link to the original site isn't available due to the fact that the main server for the site is down and may not be recovered. The site had mods that dated to earlier than 0.20 - yeah, the site is relatively old.

I just checked - the site isn't a mod site anymore. Here is the site[REDACTED].

Oh, and MeCripp - the mod isn't like HullCam VDS at all - you need to recover the film, not transmit.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-18T23:13:30Z" title="05/18/2015 11:13  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 18, 2015</time> by sumghai**
  
Removed reference to pirate mod website

Astrofox, just so you know, the defunct website you've mentioned was shut down for illegally scraping add-ons from the original official Kerbal Spaceport website. Please refrain from referring to it in the future.

@ Sumghai

I actually didn't know that, Thanks for telling me about the issue.
